column4: Can apt be set to download a packages dependencies automatically? trying to install libsdl-dev but getting a heap of umet libraries..
pastebin the output and your sources.list
pastebin the whole message as well as your sources
sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install libsdl1.2-dev   <-- still the same thing after this?
Doesn't seem to have attempted to install, however to throw some failed to fetch errors on the update in relation to the new sources and Sources.gz (404 error)
hmm can you put those errors on pastebin as well?
it is most likely an issue with your repository setup
the update now goes through without error, and you still have the same error?
what does 'sudo apt-get install libesd0-dev' say?
Depends: libaudiofile-dev but it is not going to be installed'
keep trying to install what it says until it gives you something meaningfull
I need to reboot now, another thing you could try is passing -v to apt-get and see if it gives you more info.  Eventually you usually get to the root of the problem

Nothing will install and uninstall with apt, is there any way I can 'check' the integrity of apt itself, something has obviously messed with a configuration file or the like...might just be easier to reinstall
I noticed, that there was a problems witht he codeblocks install.  It may be complaining about that until you resolve it

Very difficult to install the dependency it's looking for because once I download it, libpango1.0-common for example wont install because some totally unrelated dependency is unsatisfiable...how difficult is it to reinstall apt-get?
you shouldn't download and overwrite current versions, that usually causes trouble.  Can you remove codeblocks for now and see if you can resolve your other problems?
Uninstalled codeblocks and now apt will install again....how weird
